intro: Strongylocaryum latius, commonly known as the broad-leaved strongylocaryum, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural practices.
